item.title: Add Custom Validations With Lombok Builders
item.description: Introduction Java Beans encapsulates many objects into one single object and have getters and setters to access the properties. This code is boilerplate and can be a candidate for code gen. IDEs can help in achieve this type of code as well. But for the purpose of this post lets use Project Lombok and see how it can helps for builder pattern with validationa. item.title: Create a Docker Image for RESTful Java Service
item.description: Introduction Docker is a container platform to build and run applications within containers. These docker containers are very light weight compared to virtual machines and are standalone software packages which can run anywhere where docker engine installed. For detailed instructions to install docker see here. To deploy a RESTful Java service onto a docker image we need o build the image with the following layers from bottom up. Here are the required software packges need to be installed

item.title: About
item.description: I am ,Thirupathi Reddy Guduru , a passionate software engineer, Java & Scala lover. I like to read books and follow technology websites like Infoq , DZone and jaxenter. Interested in distributed and micro-services based architectures. I did my masters in computer science more than a decade ago. I started writing code since 2002 but i started writing code for living since 2006. And also I’m a husband and a father of a two kids.
